pr_title: fix build application not to assert exec false exit value

timeline.message: fix build application not to assert exec false exit valuae

timeline.bodyText: why can't the check be done in this method instead of changing all the calling It test classes?
timeline.author: vanajamukkara

replies.bodyText: The source application might build more than 1 archive and we don't know what file name it will be, so it is better to leave it to the It class to do that.
replies.author: sankarpn

replies.bodyText: what is the stderr when it returns non-zero on success?
replies.author: vanajamukkara

replies.bodyText:
I see the stderr is empty when it returns non-zero code on success, how about checking for 0 exit value or (non-zero and stderr is empty) for success? on failure, stderr is not empty, is that correct?
https://build.weblogick8s.org:8443/job/wko-kind-nightly/95/artifact/logdir/jenkins-wko-kind-nightly-95/wl_k8s_test_results/diagnosticlogs/ItCrossDomainTransaction/ItCrossDomainTransaction.out/*view*/
replies.author: vanajamukkara

replies.bodyText:
I don't know if we can rely on that logic. IMO a simple assertion in the It class would be sufficient. Like this
assertTrue(clusterViewAppPath.toFile().exists(), "Application archive is not available");
replies.author: sankarpn

replies.bodyText: Is that check done in all the existing it classes which calls this method? If not, that needs to be done in the It classes as part of this PR as this assertion is removed here, otherwise tests will proceed even if the application build fails.
replies.author: vanajamukkara

replies.bodyText: Only 1 class was missing the assert. Added the assertion in ItManagedCoherence.java
replies.author: sankarpn

timeline.bodyText: doesn't the copy files/dir from pod fail if the build is not successful?
timeline.author: vanajamukkara

replies.bodyText: Yes, but that is what we expect right?. Most of  the time what we  see is exit code issue even though build is successful.
replies.author: sankarpn

replies.bodyText: Yes, we expect it to fail. So, if the build is not successful, will it fail at this point?
replies.author: vanajamukkara

replies.bodyText: if it fails here, we don't need to add any additional checks in It class
replies.author: vanajamukkara

replies.bodyText: Depends on the source app. If the build failed but created a empty distDir this copy command may not fail. It will simply copy the empty directory to local file system.
replies.author: sankarpn

timeline.message: Asserting that file is available  after build
